title: Trusting God's Plan
verse: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you.'
reflection: God has a plan for each of us. We are called to trust in His purpose, knowing that He is guiding our steps with love and wisdom.
prompt: What is God teaching you through this verse?

title: Strength in Weakness
verse: 'My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.'
reflection: In our weakness, God's strength shines brightest. We are invited to rely on His grace and let go of self-reliance.
prompt: Where do you need God's strength today?

title: Peace Beyond Understanding
verse: 'And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.'
reflection: God offers a peace that surpasses our circumstances. When we turn to Him in prayer, He calms our hearts and minds.
prompt: How can you invite God's peace into your life today?

title: New Every Morning
verse: 'His mercies are new every morning.'
reflection: Each day is a fresh start with God. His mercy never runs out.
prompt: What new mercy do you need to receive today?

title: The Lord is My Shepherd
verse: 'The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.'
reflection: God cares for us as a shepherd cares for his sheep. We lack nothing in Him.
prompt: How has God provided for you recently?

title: Be Still and Know
verse: 'Be still, and know that I am God.'
reflection: In the midst of chaos, God invites us to rest in His presence and sovereignty.
prompt: Where do you need to be still before God today?

title: God is Love
verse: 'God is love. Whoever lives in love lives in God, and God in them.'
reflection: Love is the essence of God's character. We are called to reflect His love to others.
prompt: How can you show God's love to someone today?

title: Do Not Fear
verse: 'Do not fear, for I am with you.'
reflection: God's presence dispels fear. He promises to strengthen and help us.
prompt: What fear can you surrender to God today?

title: Seek First the Kingdom
verse: 'But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.'
reflection: When we put God first, He takes care of our needs.
prompt: How can you seek God's kingdom first today?

title: Light of the World
verse: 'You are the light of the world.'
reflection: Jesus calls us to shine His light in a dark world.
prompt: Where can you bring light today?

title: God Works for Good
verse: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him.'
reflection: God can redeem every situation for our good and His glory.
prompt: Where do you need to trust God is working for good?

title: Ask, Seek, Knock
verse: 'Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.'
reflection: God invites us to come to Him with our needs and desires.
prompt: What do you need to ask God for today?

title: The Greatest Commandment
verse: 'Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.'
reflection: Loving God is our highest calling and greatest joy.
prompt: How can you love God more fully today?

title: A New Creation
verse: 'If anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!'
reflection: In Christ, we are made new. Our past no longer defines us.
prompt: What new thing is God doing in your life?

title: The Lord is Near
verse: 'The Lord is near to all who call on him.'
reflection: God is never far from us. He hears every prayer.
prompt: How can you draw near to God today?

title: He Gives Strength
verse: 'Those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength.'
reflection: God renews our strength when we place our hope in Him.
prompt: Where do you need God's strength today?

title: Rejoice Always
verse: 'Rejoice always, pray continually, give thanks in all circumstances.'
reflection: Joy and gratitude are choices we can make every day.
prompt: What can you thank God for today?

title: He Will Guide You
verse: 'I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go.'
reflection: God promises to guide us step by step.
prompt: Where do you need God's guidance?

title: God is Faithful
verse: 'The one who calls you is faithful, and he will do it.'
reflection: God always keeps His promises.
prompt: What promise of God are you holding onto?

title: Let Your Light Shine
verse: 'Let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.'
reflection: Our actions can point others to God.
prompt: How can you shine God's light today?

title: He Cares for You
verse: 'Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you.'
reflection: God invites us to give Him our worries.
prompt: What anxiety can you give to God today?

title: The Fruit of the Spirit
verse: 'But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, forbearance, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness and self-control.'
reflection: The Holy Spirit produces beautiful fruit in our lives.
prompt: Which fruit of the Spirit do you want to grow in?

title: God is Our Refuge
verse: 'God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.'
reflection: God is a safe place in times of trouble.
prompt: Where do you need God's refuge today?

title: He Will Never Leave You
verse: 'Never will I leave you; never will I forsake you.'
reflection: God's presence is constant and unchanging.
prompt: How does it comfort you to know God is always with you?

title: The Lord is My Light
verse: 'The Lord is my light and my salvation—whom shall I fear?'
reflection: God's light dispels all fear and darkness.
prompt: Where do you need God's light to shine?

title: He Restores My Soul
verse: 'He restores my soul. He guides me along the right paths for his name’s sake.'
reflection: God brings healing and direction to our lives.
prompt: Where do you need restoration?

title: God is With You Wherever You Go
verse: 'The Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.'
reflection: God's presence goes before us and stays with us.
prompt: What new step can you take knowing God is with you?

title: He Will Give You Rest
verse: 'Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.'
reflection: Jesus offers true rest for our souls.
prompt: Where do you need to receive God's rest?

title: God's Grace is Sufficient
verse: 'My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.'
reflection: God's grace covers every need and shortcoming.
prompt: How can you rely on God's grace today?

title: Give Thanks to the Lord
verse: 'Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good; his love endures forever.'
reflection: Gratitude opens our hearts to God's goodness and love.
prompt: What are you thankful for today?
